message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.SI, cs.CV 

The paper introduces a new dynamic model for recognizing activities and spatial context using wearable sensors. This involves the use of probabilistic inference procedures such as particle filtering and pruned exact inference. The paper also emphasizes the need to minimize the amount of hardware an individual must wear, which suggests a focus on human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The use of sensor data and GPS measurements suggests a focus on machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of a graphical model, which suggests a focus on computer vision (cs.CV) and statistical inference (cs.SI).
